item.title: iPayYou launches bitcoin wallet
item.description:
iPayYou launches bitcoin wallet

In a press release sent to CoinReport, iPayYou said its wallet lets consumers hold, purchase, sell, send and receive bitcoin safely and securely through the company's website, with all of the clients' funds stored in their own personal bitcoin account.

item.title: ChinaLedger - China's Own Personal Blockchain Project - NEWSBTC
item.description:
ChinaLedger - China's Own Personal Blockchain Project - NEWSBTC

China has decided to start its own distributed ledger alliance, calling it ChinaLedger, the resulting blockchain platform will be used by the Chinese fintech sector. Read more... The giant has finally woken up; China has entered the blockchain race.

item.title: Glenn Hutchins: Blockchain is Good, Bitcoin is Important - CoinDesk
item.description:
Glenn Hutchins: Blockchain is Good, Bitcoin is Important - CoinDesk

Silver Lake co-founder and Federal Reserve Bank of New York board member Glenn Hutchins took the stage at Consensus 2016 to deliver an overarching speech about why public blockchains like bitcoin still matter in the age of big bank ledger efforts today.

item.title: BitPay CEO Unveils Bitcoin Debit Card at Consensus 2016 Conference
item.description:
BitPay CEO Unveils Bitcoin Debit Card at Consensus 2016 Conference

BitPay unveiled today their new bitcoin debit card offering. The new card program was announced in a presentation by BitPay CEO Stephen Pair, at the 2-day blockchain conference Consensus 2016, currently being held in New York. According to a CoinDesk report, the new card is issued by Metropolitan Commercial Bank and can be used in all 50 states.

item.title: Gavin Anderson Refutes Hacking Claim to Assert Craig Wright Is Satoshi
item.description:
Gavin Anderson Refutes Hacking Claim to Assert Craig Wright Is Satoshi

At Consensus 2016, the cryptocurrency- and blockchain-industry conference currently being held in New York, Chief scientist of the Bitcoin Foundation Gavin Andersen has stuck with his assertion that Craig Wright is Satoshi Nakamoto, following his meeting with the Australian entrepreneur.

item.title: Is Blockchain a Better Payments Rail? Panelists Divided at Consensus 2016 - CoinDesk
item.description:
Is Blockchain a Better Payments Rail? Panelists Divided at Consensus 2016 - CoinDesk

Distributed ledgers are often referred to as a new database technology, but could they come to replace existing payments rails? The subject was the center of discussion among Julio Faura of Spanish megabank Santander; Marwan Forzley of blockchain payments startup Align Commerce; Gys Gyman of global consultancy Deloitte; Chris Larsen of distributed ledger leader Ripple; and Elizabeth Rossiello of bitcoin payments startup BitPesa today, the group representing a mix of financial incumbents and startups.

item.title: How bitcoins work
item.description:
How bitcoins work

If Craig Wright is who he says he is, the Australian entrepreneur is the creator of bitcoin previously known only by the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto -- who is supposedly worth about 1 million bitcoins, or some $450 million. But how exactly do you use the digital currency?

item.title: Legal status of Blockchain proof-of-existence TX (USA court)
item.description:
Legal status of Blockchain proof-of-existence TX (USA court)

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required.
